caption.p: Comparative prevalences of viral infections detected among patients in Glasgow, United Kingdom, 2005 to 2013. Prevalence was measured as the proportion of patients testing positive to a given virus among those tested in each month. ( A and B) Asynchronous seasonality, explained by negative epidemiological interactions. ( C and D) Synchronous seasonality, explained by positive epidemiological interactions. œÅ = significant correlation coefficients from Bayesian multivariate disease mapping analysis of viral infection time series shown in Fig. 3. See Table 1 for a full description of the viruses.
